text.content: Contracts can be associated with documents. Linking a contract to related documents helps keep all relevant information about a contract together and easily accessible.

Create a software maintenance contract example

rich_text.plain_text: Create a software maintenance contract example

text.content: One common use case for the Contract Management application is creating a contract to track maintenance payments for enterprise software. You can use this example to learn how to create a software maintenance contract.
Add an asset to a contract

rich_text.plain_text: Add an asset to a contract

text.content: You can associate contracts with specific assets, including software licenses.
Add a user to a contract

rich_text.plain_text: Add a user to a contract

text.content: A contract can cover specific users. For example, you may use a contract to hire a group of temporary workers.
Add a configuration item to a contract

rich_text.plain_text: Add a configuration item to a contract

text.content: Contracts can be associated with configuration items. You can link a contract with configuration items to clarify what the contract legally covers.

One common use case for the Contract Management application is creating a contract to track maintenance payments for enterprise software. You can use this example to learn how to create a software maintenance contract.

The goal of this example is to create a contract that shows the total amount of maintenance that must be paid for the software application, independent of different license purchases made over time. The Software Asset Management plugin must be activated to use this example.
, and selecting the application model created in step 1.
